DOC.brief_summary: In present study , assess relation diastolic dysfunction myocardial fibrosis hypertensive patient without diabetes mellitus . A total 20 medically treated ambulatory non-diabetic hypertensive patient normal leave ventricular ( LV ) systolic function enrol study . Myocardial fibrosis evaluate serum concentration amino-terminal propeptides type I III procollagen ( PINP PIIINP ) . All patient underwent examination diastolic function echocardiography technetium-99m ( 99mTc ) radionuclide ventriculography . There 8 patient PINP ≦53 μg/l ( group 1 ) 12 patient PINP > 53 μg/l ( group 2 ) . Patients group 2 significantly low LV peak filling rate ( PFR ; 3.2 ± 0.3 vs. 2.5 ± 0.2 end-diastolic volume/s ) short time PFR ( 257 ± 41 vs. 174 ± 22 m ) . Besides , group 2 patient also low right ventricle PFR ( 1.9 ± 0.2 vs. 1.5 ± 0.1 end-diastolic volume/s ) short time PFR ( 221 ± 29 vs. 154 ± 29 m ) . Echocardiographic parameter LV diastolic dysfunction ( E/A ratio mitral flow , deceleration time E flow , velocity pulmonary venous flow [ retrograde A wave , systolic /diastolic velocity ratio ] , isovolumetric relaxation time , Tei index ) comparable two group . In multiple regression analysis , LV time peak fill rate parameter independently predict serum PINP level ( p < 0.05 ) . In conclusion , elevate serum PINP level reflect LV diastolic dysfunction hypertensive patient without diabetes .
